p: Substantial effects could be realized even by simply reducing meat consumption, such as through efforts like the Meatless Monday campaign [ 219], or partial substitution of plant protein in ground and processed meats [ 200]. Another potential future alternative is cultured meat production. Cultured meat is laboratory produced using in vitro tissue engineering techniques, and initial LCA estimates show that it could lead to 78%â€“96% lower GHG emissions than conventionally produced European meat [ 220], while simultaneously avoiding all of the animal welfare impacts of intensive production.
